libs.device_data package¶

Submodules¶

libs.device_data.device_data module¶

class libs.device_data.device_data.UAgentInfo(userAgent, httpAccept)¶

Bases: object

The UAgentInfo class encapsulates information about a browser’s connection to your web site. You can use it to find out whether the browser asking for your site’s content is probably running on a mobile device. The methods were written so you can be as granular as you want. For example, enquiring whether it’s as specific as an iPod Touch or as general as a smartphone class device. The object’s methods return true, or false.

detectAmazonSilk()¶

Return detection of an Amazon Kindle Fire in Silk mode.

Detects if the current Amazon device is using the Silk Browser. Note: Typically used by the the Kindle Fire.

detectAndroid()¶

Return detection of an Android device

Detects any Android OS-based device: phone, tablet, and multi-media player. Also detects Google TV.

detectAndroidPhone()¶

Return detection of an Android phone

Detects if the current device is a (small-ish) Android OS-based device used for calling and/or multi-media (like a Samsung Galaxy Player). Google says these devices will have ‘Android’ AND ‘mobile’ in user agent. Ignores tablets (Honeycomb and later).

detectAndroidTablet()¶

Return detection of an Android tablet

Detects if the current device is a (self-reported) Android tablet. Google says these devices will have ‘Android’ and NOT ‘mobile’ in their user agent.

detectAndroidWebKit()¶

Return detection of an Android WebKit browser

Detects if the current device is an Android OS-based device and the browser is based on WebKit.

detectArchos()¶

Return detection of an Archos media player

Detects if the current device is an Archos media player/Internet tablet.

detectBada()¶

Return detection of a Bada device

Detects a device running the Bada OS from Samsung.

detectBlackBerry()¶

Return detection of Blackberry

Detects if the current browser is any BlackBerry. Includes the PlayBook.

detectBlackBerry10Phone()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry 10 OS phone

Detects if the current browser is a BlackBerry 10 OS phone. Excludes the PlayBook.

detectBlackBerryHigh()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry device with a better browser

Detects if the current browser is a BlackBerry device AND has a more capable recent browser. Excludes the Playbook. Examples, Storm, Bold, Tour, Curve2 Excludes the new BlackBerry OS 6 and 7 browser!!

detectBlackBerryLow()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry device with a poorer browser

Detects if the current browser is a BlackBerry device AND has an older, less capable browser. Examples: Pearl, 8800, Curve1

detectBlackBerryTablet()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry Tablet

Detects if the current browser is on a BlackBerry tablet device. Example: PlayBook

detectBlackBerryTouch()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry touchscreen device

Detects if the current browser is a BlackBerry Touch device, such as the Storm, Torch, and Bold Touch. Excludes the Playbook.

detectBlackBerryWebKit()¶

Return detection of a Blackberry device with WebKit browser

Detects if the current browser is a BlackBerry device AND uses a WebKit-based browser. These are signatures for the new BlackBerry OS 6. Examples: Torch. Includes the Playbook.

detectBrewDevice()¶

Return detection of a Brew device

Detects whether the device is a Brew-powered device.

detectDangerHiptop()¶

Return detection of a Danger Hiptop

Detects the Danger Hiptop device.

detectFirefoxOS()¶

Return detection of a Firefox OS mobile device

Detects a mobile device (probably) running the Firefox OS.

detectFirefoxOSPhone()¶

Return detection of a Firefox OS phone

Detects a phone (probably) running the Firefox OS.

detectFirefoxOSTablet()¶

Return detection of a Firefox OS tablet

Detects a tablet (probably) running the Firefox OS.

detectGameConsole()¶

Return detection of any Game Console

Detects if the current device is an Internet-capable game console.

detectGamingHandheld()¶

Return detection of a gaming handheld with a modern iPhone-class browser

Detects if the current device is a handheld gaming device with
a touchscreen and modern iPhone-class browser. Includes the Playstation Vita.
detectGarminNuvifone()¶

Return detection of a Garmin Nuvifone

Detects if the current browser is a Garmin Nuvifone.

detectGoogleTV()¶

Return detection of GoogleTV

Detects if the current device is a GoogleTV.

detectIos()¶

Return detection of an Apple iOS device

Detects any iOS device: iPhone, iPod Touch, iPad.

detectIpad()¶

Return detection of an iPad

Detects if the current device is an iPad tablet.

detectIphone()¶

Return detection of an iPhone

Detects if the current device is an iPhone.

detectIphoneOrIpod()¶

Return detection of an iPhone or iPod Touch

Detects if the current device is an iPhone or iPod Touch.

detectIpod()¶

Return detection of an iPod Touch

Detects if the current device is an iPod Touch.

detectKindle()¶

Return detection of a Kindle

Detects if the current device is an Amazon Kindle (eInk devices only). Note: For the Kindle Fire, use the normal Android methods.

detectMaemoTablet()¶

Return detection of a Maemo OS tablet

Detects if the current device is on one of the Maemo-based Nokia Internet Tablets.

detectMeego()¶

Return detection of a Meego device

Detects a device running the Meego OS.

detectMeegoPhone()¶

Return detection of a Meego phone

Detects a phone running the Meego OS.

detectMidpCapable()¶

Return detection of a MIDP mobile Java-capable device

Detects if the current device supports MIDP, a mobile Java technology.

detectMobileLong()¶

Return detection of any mobile device using the more thorough method

The longer and more thorough way to detect for a mobile device. Will probably detect most feature phones, smartphone-class devices, Internet Tablets, Internet-enabled game consoles, etc. This ought to catch a lot of the more obscure and older devices, also – but no promises on thoroughness!

detectMobileQuick()¶

Return detection of any mobile device using the quicker method

Detects if the current device is a mobile device. This method catches most of the popular modern devices. Excludes Apple iPads and other modern tablets.

detectNintendo()¶

Return detection of Nintendo

Detects if the current device is a Nintendo game device.

detectOperaMobile()¶

Return detection of an Opera browser for a mobile device

Detects Opera Mobile or Opera Mini.

detectPalmOS()¶

Return detection of a PalmOS device

Detects if the current browser is on a PalmOS device.

detectPalmWebOS()¶

Return detection of a Palm WebOS device

Detects if the current browser is on a Palm device running the new WebOS.

detectS60OssBrowser()¶

Return detection of Symbian S60 Browser

Detects if the current browser is the Symbian S60 Open Source Browser.

detectSailfish()¶

Return detection of a Sailfish OS device.

Detects a device running the Sailfish OS.

detectSailfishPhone()¶

Return detection of a Sailfish phone

Detects a phone running the Sailfish OS.

detectSmartphone()¶

Return detection of a general smartphone device

Checks to see whether the device is any ‘smartphone’. Note: It’s better to use DetectTierIphone() for modern touchscreen devices.

detectSonyMylo()¶

Return detection of a Sony Mylo device

Detects if the current browser is a Sony Mylo device.

detectSonyPlaystation()¶

Return detection of Sony Playstation

Detects if the current device is a Sony Playstation.

detectSymbianOS()¶

Return detection of SymbianOS

Detects if the current device is any Symbian OS-based device, including older S60, Series 70, Series 80, Series 90, and UIQ, or other browsers running on these devices.

detectTierIphone()¶

Return detection of any device in the iPhone/Android/WP7/WebOS Tier

The quick way to detect for a tier of devices. This method detects for devices which can display iPhone-optimized web content. Includes iPhone, iPod Touch, Android, Windows Phone 7, Palm WebOS, etc.

detectTierOtherPhones()¶

Return detection of a mobile device in the less capable tier

The quick way to detect for a tier of devices. This method detects for all other types of phones, but excludes the iPhone and RichCSS Tier devices.

detectTierRichCss()¶

Return detection of any device in the ‘Rich CSS’ Tier

The quick way to detect for a tier of devices. This method detects for devices which are likely to be capable of viewing CSS content optimized for the iPhone, but may not necessarily support JavaScript. Excludes all iPhone Tier devices.

detectTierTablet()¶

Return detection of any device in the Tablet Tier

The quick way to detect for a tier of devices. This method detects for the new generation of HTML 5 capable, larger screen tablets. Includes iPad, Android (e.g., Xoom), BB Playbook, WebOS, etc.

detectTizen()¶

Return detection of a Tizen device

Detects a device running the Tizen smartphone OS.

detectTizenTV()¶

Return detection of a Tizen smart TV

Detects if the current browser is on a Tizen smart TV.

detectUbuntu()¶

Return detection of an Ubuntu Mobile OS mobile device

Detects a mobile device running the Ubuntu Mobile OS.

detectUbuntuPhone()¶

Return detection of an Ubuntu Mobile OS phone

Detects a phone running the Ubuntu Mobile OS.

detectUbuntuTablet()¶

Return detection of an Ubuntu Mobile OS tablet

Detects a tablet running the Ubuntu Mobile OS.

detectWapWml()¶

Return detection of a WAP- or WML-capable device

Detects whether the device supports WAP or WML.

detectWebOSTV()¶

Return detection of a WebOS smart TV

Detects if the current browser is on a WebOS smart TV.

detectWebOSTablet()¶

Return detection of an HP WebOS tablet

Detects if the current browser is on an HP tablet running WebOS.

detectWebkit()¶

Return detection of a WebKit browser

Detects if the current browser is based on WebKit.

detectWindowsMobile()¶

Return detection of Windows Mobile

Detects if the current browser is a Windows Mobile device. Excludes Windows Phone 7 devices. Focuses on Windows Mobile 6.xx and earlier.

detectWindowsPhone()¶

Return detection of a Windows Phone device

Detects if the current browser is a Windows Phone 7, 8, or 10 device

detectWindowsPhone10()¶

Return detection of Windows Phone 10

Detects if the current browser is a Windows Phone 10 device.

detectWindowsPhone7()¶

Return detection of Windows Phone 7

Detects if the current browser is a Windows Phone 7 device.

detectWindowsPhone8()¶

Return detection of Windows Phone 8

Detects if the current browser is a Windows Phone 8 device.

detectXbox()¶

Return detection of Xbox

Detects if the current device is a Microsoft Xbox.

getHttpAccept()¶

Return the lower case HTTP_ACCEPT

getIsIphone()¶

Return whether the device is an Iphone or iPod Touch

getIsTierGenericMobile()¶

Return whether the device is a generic, less-capable mobile device.

getIsTierIphone()¶

Return whether the device is in the Iphone Tier.

getIsTierTablet()¶

Return whether the device is in the Tablet Tier.
